title: Implement armour/wounds/movement parsing for stat blocks
description:
Parse armour, wounds, and movement values from stat blocks.

## Armour Formats
```
Armour: Toughened Skin (All 4). Total TB: 10
Armour	Storm Trooper Carapace (6 All)
```
- May specify by location: (Head 4, Body 6, Arms 4, Legs 4)
- May use 'All X' for uniform coverage
- May include armour name
- TB (Toughness Bonus) is derived, not stored

## Wounds Format
```
Wounds: 48
Wounds	15
```
- Simple numeric value
- Label may be 'Wounds:' or just 'Wounds' with tab

## Movement Format
```
Movement: 5/10/15/30
```
- Four values: Half/Full/Charge/Run
- May not be present in all formats

## Output
```javascript
{
  armour: {
    name: 'Toughened Skin',  // or 'Storm Trooper Carapace'
    head: 4,
    body: 4,
    leftArm: 4,
    rightArm: 4,
    leftLeg: 4,
    rightLeg: 4
  },
  wounds: {
    max: 48
  },
  movement: {
    half: 5,
    full: 10,
    charge: 15,
    run: 30
  }
}
```

## Edge Cases
- 'All X' means all locations get value X
- Some formats don't include movement (calculate from Agility)
- Armour may be 'None' or missing

title: Create NPCV2 actor from parsed stat block data
description:
Convert parsed stat block data into a valid NPCV2 actor.

## Input
Structured data from parser module containing:
- name, characteristics, wounds, movement
- skills, talents, traits (as arrays)
- weapons, armour
- notes/additional text

## Process
1. **Create base actor** with name and characteristics
2. **Set wounds** from parsed max value
3. **Create/link skill items** - match to compendium or create inline
4. **Create/link talent items** - match to compendium or create inline
5. **Create/link trait items** - match to compendium or create inline
6. **Create weapon items** - either inline or embedded
7. **Set armour values** - NPCV2 supports simple armour values
8. **Set notes** - additional text, footnotes, gear, threat rating

## Compendium Matching
For skills, talents, and traits:
1. Search compendium by name (fuzzy match)
2. If found, create link/reference
3. If not found, create inline item with warning

## NPCV2 Specifics
NPCV2 supports simplified data:
- `system.simpleWeapons` for inline weapons
- `system.simpleArmour` for flat armour values
- Sparse skill storage (only trained skills)

## Output
- Created Actor document (type: 'npcV2')
- Optionally open sheet after creation
- Return validation warnings for unmatched items

title: Implement skills/talents/traits parsing for stat blocks
description:
Parse skills, talents, and traits from stat block text.

## Skills Format
```
Skills: Awareness (Per), Climb (S) +10.
Skills	Acrobatics (A), Awareness (Per), Common Lore (Underworld) (Int), Interrogation +10 (WP)
```
- Comma-separated list
- Skill name followed by characteristic abbreviation in parentheses
- Training level indicated by +10 or +20
- Specialist skills have specialization before characteristic: Common Lore (Underworld) (Int)

## Talents Format
```
Talents: Berserk Charge, Bestial Fury†, Blind Fighting, Combat Master
Talents	Basic Weapon Training (Bolt, SP), Disarm, Melee Weapon Training (Shock)
```
- Comma-separated list
- May have specializations in parentheses
- May have footnote markers (†, *, etc.)
- Multiple specializations: Basic Weapon Training (Bolt, SP)

## Traits Format
```
Traits: Bestial, Brutal Charge, Dark-Sight, Fear (2), Natural Armour, Size (Hulking), Unnatural Strength (x2)
Traits	None
```
- Comma-separated list
- May have numeric values: Fear (2)
- May have text values: Size (Hulking)
- May have multipliers: Unnatural Strength (x2)
- 'None' means empty array

## Output
```javascript
{
  skills: [
    { name: 'Awareness', characteristic: 'Per', training: 'trained' },
    { name: 'Climb', characteristic: 'S', training: 'plus10' },
    { name: 'Common Lore', specialization: 'Underworld', characteristic: 'Int', training: 'trained' }
  ],
  talents: [
    { name: 'Berserk Charge' },
    { name: 'Basic Weapon Training', specialization: 'Bolt' },
    { name: 'Basic Weapon Training', specialization: 'SP' }
  ],
  traits: [
    { name: 'Bestial' },
    { name: 'Fear', value: 2 },
    { name: 'Size', value: 'Hulking' },
    { name: 'Unnatural Strength', value: 2 }  // x2 -> 2
  ]
}
```

title: Implement weapon parsing for stat blocks
description:
Parse weapon stat lines from stat block text.

## Weapon Formats
### Melee
```
Claws (1d10+10 R, Pen 1; Razor Sharp, Tearing)
shock maul (1d10+3 I; Shocking)
```

### Ranged
```
Combat shotgun (30m; S/3/–; 1d10+4 I; Pen 0; Clip 18; Reload Full; Scatter)
hand cannon (35m; S/–/–; 1d10+4 I; Pen 2; Clip 5; Reload 2 Full)
```

## Parsing Rules
1. **Name**: Text before first parenthesis
2. **Range**: Number followed by 'm' (melee weapons have no range)
3. **Rate of Fire**: Pattern like S/3/– or S/–/– (Single/Semi/Full)
4. **Damage**: Pattern like 1d10+4 I or 2d10 R
5. **Penetration**: 'Pen X' or 'Pen 0'
6. **Clip**: 'Clip X' for ammo capacity
7. **Reload**: 'Reload X' (Half, Full, 2 Full, etc.)
8. **Qualities**: Remaining items (Scatter, Tearing, Razor Sharp, Shocking)

## Output
```javascript
{
  weapons: [
    {
      name: 'Claws',
      class: 'melee',
      damage: '1d10+10',
      damageType: 'R',
      penetration: 1,
      qualities: ['Razor Sharp', 'Tearing']
    },
    {
      name: 'Combat shotgun',
      class: 'basic',  // inferred from range/type
      range: 30,
      rateOfFire: { single: true, semi: 3, full: false },
      damage: '1d10+4',
      damageType: 'I',
      penetration: 0,
      clip: 18,
      reload: 'Full',
      qualities: ['Scatter']
    }
  ]
}
```

## Edge Cases
- Damage types: R (Rending), I (Impact), E (Energy), X (Explosive)
- Missing penetration defaults to 0
- '–' in RoF means not available
- Parenthetical notes in qualities: '(or 3 w/Man-Stopper Rounds)'

title: Create stat block parser core module
description:
Create the core parsing engine for NPC stat blocks.

## Location
`src/module/applications/dialogs/stat-block-parser.mjs`

## Responsibilities
1. **Format Detection** - Identify which format the input uses
2. **Characteristic Parsing** - Extract all 9 characteristics + unnatural modifiers
3. **Skills Parsing** - Parse skill names, specializations, and training levels (+10, +20)
4. **Talents Parsing** - Parse talent names with specializations in parentheses
5. **Traits Parsing** - Parse traits with numeric values (Fear (2), Size (Hulking))
6. **Weapons Parsing** - Parse weapon stat lines (name, range, RoF, damage, pen, qualities)
7. **Armour Parsing** - Parse armour values, potentially by location
8. **Movement/Wounds** - Parse movement rates and wound values

## Output Format
Return a structured object matching NPCV2 DataModel schema:
```javascript
{
  name: 'Clawed Fiend',
  characteristics: { weaponSkill: { base: 43 }, ... },
  unnaturalCharacteristics: { strength: 2, ... },
  wounds: { max: 48 },
  skills: [...],
  talents: [...],
  traits: [...],
  weapons: [...],
  armour: { head: 4, body: 4, ... },
  movement: { half: 5, full: 10, charge: 15, run: 30 },
  notes: '...'
}
```

Include parsing tests for both example formats in ticket description.

title: Weapon Comparison Dialog - Side-by-side weapon stat comparison
notes:
## Weapon Comparison Dialog

### Overview
Create a comparison dialog that allows players to compare two weapons side-by-side to make informed purchase/equipment decisions.

### User Stories
1. As a player, I want to compare my current weapon with a potential upgrade
2. As a GM, I want to quickly compare NPC weapons for balance
3. As a player, I want to see the effective difference when considering modifications

### Design

#### Launch Methods
1. **From weapon sheet**: 'Compare' button opens dialog with current weapon pre-selected
2. **From inventory**: Multi-select weapons -> 'Compare' action
3. **From compendium**: Right-click -> 'Compare with...'

#### Dialog Layout
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ Weapon Comparison                               [Close] │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ ┌─────────────────────┐  ┌─────────────────────┐       │
│ │ [Drop Zone A]       │  │ [Drop Zone B]       │       │
│ │ or Select Weapon ▼  │  │ or Select Weapon ▼  │       │
│ └─────────────────────┘  └─────────────────────┘       │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                    COMPARISON TABLE                     │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Stat          │  Weapon A     │  Weapon B     │ Diff   │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Damage        │  1d10+3       │  1d10+5       │ +2 ▲   │
│ Penetration   │  4            │  6            │ +2 ▲   │
│ Range         │  30m          │  40m          │ +10m ▲ │
│ RoF           │  S/-/6        │  S/3/6        │ Semi ▲ │
│ Clip          │  30           │  24           │ -6 ▼   │
│ Reload        │  Full         │  Half         │ ▲      │
│ Weight        │  4kg          │  5kg          │ +1kg ▼ │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Qualities A: Reliable, Accurate                        │
│ Qualities B: Tearing, Proven (3)                       │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Only in A: Reliable, Accurate                          │
│ Only in B: Tearing, Proven (3)                         │
│ Both: None                                             │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ [Swap Weapons]  [Clear]                   [Close]      │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

#### Comparison Logic
```javascript
compareWeapons(weaponA, weaponB) {
    return {
        damage: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveDamageLabel,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveDamageLabel,
            diff: this._compareDamage(weaponA, weaponB)
        },
        penetration: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectivePenetration,
            b: weaponB.system.effectivePenetration,
            diff: weaponB.system.effectivePenetration - weaponA.system.effectivePenetration,
            better: 'higher'
        },
        range: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveRange,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveRange,
            diff: weaponB.system.effectiveRange - weaponA.system.effectiveRange,
            better: 'higher'
        },
        // etc...
        
        qualities: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveSpecial,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveSpecial,
            onlyA: setDifference(a, b),
            onlyB: setDifference(b, a),
            both: setIntersection(a, b)
        }
    };
}
```

#### Visual Indicators
- **Green arrow up (▲)**: B is better
- **Red arrow down (▼)**: A is better  
- **Gray dash (─)**: Same value
- **Yellow (~)**: Trade-off (e.g., damage dice differ)

### Implementation

#### New Files
- `src/module/applications/dialogs/weapon-comparison-dialog.mjs`
- `src/templates/dialogs/weapon-comparison.hbs`
- `src/scss/dialogs/_weapon-comparison.scss`

#### Integration Points
- WeaponSheet: Add 'Compare' button
- AcolyteSheet inventory: Add comparison action
- Context menu: Add 'Compare with...' option

### Dependencies
- Depends on RogueTraderVTT-q2w (Modifications Integration) for effective stats

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dialog opens from weapon sheet
- [ ] Weapons can be selected via dropdown or drag-drop
- [ ] All major stats compared with visual indicators
- [ ] Qualities compared with set operations
- [ ] Diff column shows clear better/worse indicators

- [ ] Responsive layout for smaller windows

Implement characteristic parsing for stat blocks
description:
Implement parsing logic for characteristics in both stat block formats.

## Format 1: Traditional Horizontal Table
```
WS BS S T Ag Int Per WP Fel
(10) (10) (10)
43 — 59 53 47 16 54 23 04
```
- Header row defines order
- Second row has unnatural modifiers in parentheses (aligned to columns)
- Third row has base values
- '—' indicates no value (typically BS for beasts)

## Format 2: Vertical List
```
Weapon Skill	38
Ballistic Skill	38
Strength	38
...
```
- Each characteristic on own line
- Full name followed by tab/spaces and value
- No unnatural modifiers in this format (check Traits for Unnatural X)

## Output
```javascript
{
  characteristics: {
    weaponSkill: { base: 43 },
    ballisticSkill: { base: 0 },  // for '—'
    strength: { base: 59 },
    // ...
  },
  unnaturalCharacteristics: {
    strength: 2,      // from (x2) or (10) 
    toughness: 2,
    perception: 2
  }
}
```

## Edge Cases
- Handle both abbreviated (WS, BS, S, T) and full names
- Handle '—', '-', or empty for no value
- Handle unnatural as (x2) or flat bonus (10)
- Handle leading zeros (04 -> 4)
